etymology.description: semantic: 合 + 手; later alternative glyph of 拏/挐 for ‘to take with hand’.
etymology.interpretation: Combines 合 ‘to close, to join’ placed over 手 ‘hand’, evoking a hand bringing something together or grasping it. The imagery points to taking or holding with the hand, and this form later displaced earlier variants 拏/挐 in common usage.

examples.chinese: 请把这个杯子拿好(請把這個杯子拿好)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ zhège bēizi ná hǎo.

examples.chinese: 他拿起书就走了(他拿起書就走了)。
examples.pinyin: Tā ná qǐ shū jiù zǒu le.
examples.english: He picked up the book and left.

examples.chinese: 出门别忘了拿雨伞(出門別忘了拿雨傘)。
examples.pinyin: Chūmén bié wàng le ná yǔsǎn.
examples.english: Don’t forget to take an umbrella when you go out.
